details.title: Mizoram: Counting to begin at 8
details.content: Counting of the ballots is set to begin at 8 at across the state of Mizoram.
Stay tuned to TNIE for all the LIVE UPDATES from Mizoram.

details.title: Visuals from outside a counting centre in Aizawl
details.content:
Visuals from outside a counting centre in Aizawl. Counting of votes for #MizoramAssemblyElections2018 will start at 8 am today. pic.twitter.com/BB2jxdz0mI

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

details.title: Key issues in Mizoram: Prohibition
details.content: The Congress government had lifted the ban on liquor in 2014, although it regulated the amount of alcohol a person could buy. While the MNF has said it will bring back prohibition, the Congress said it will take up the issue with church and youth groups.

details.title: Key issues in Mizoram: New land use policy
details.content: The Congress government's highly popular scheme provides Rs 1 lakh to farmers who own land for use in agriculture and allied sectors.

details.title: Key issues in Mizoram: Bru refugees
details.content: The BJP has promised to repatriate the Bru refugees who are lodged in Tripura for the past 21 years.

details.title: Key issues in Mizoram: Anti-incumbency
details.content: The Congress government is facing anti-incumbency over civic amenities such as the condition of roads in the state. It has also been tainted with graft charges. The party found itself in the same situation in the 1998 assembly polls when it lost to the Mizo National Front.

details.title: Prasanta Mazumdar, TNIE North-East correspondent explains Mizoram polls
Mizoram polls: Can Congress break the jinx?
details.content: The jinx is that no political party was ever voted to power in Mizoram for three terms on the trot since its attainment of statehood in 1986. For the state’s principal opposition party Mizo National Front (MNF), the battle was to make a comeback to power after a gap of ten years. (Click Here To Read More)

details.title: People’s Pulse predicts fractured mandate in Mizoram
details.content: As per the People’s Pulse’s prediction, the ruling Congress is set to get 14-19 seats in the 40-member Assembly. Opposition Mizo National Front (MNF) will get 15-19 seats, the Zoram People’s Movement 2-4 seats and the BJP 0-2 seats.
Mizoram has a history of ten years electoral cycle since statehood barring first two years. By that logic, the Congress is supposed to be dislodged by a new dispensation.

details.title: Key candidates
details.content:
Congress: Lal Thanhawla, Lal Thanzara, V Chawngthu

Mizo National Front: R Lalzirliana, Zoramthanga

BJP: V Hluna, Hiphei

Zoram People's Movement: Lalduhoma

details.title: Counting of votes begins
details.content: Counting of votes for Rajasthan, MP, Chhattisgarh, Mizoram and Telangana begins #AssemblyElections2018

This election is a bit different from earlier ones. Mizoram has never experienced hung Assembly in the seven elections since statehood with the Congress and the MNF alternating power, but the presence of ZPM and BJP in the fray might leave its impact.

details.title: Lalduhawma: Retired IPS officer could be kingmaker
details.content: After the exit polls predicted a fractured mandate in Mizoram, the focus is suddenly on a retired IPS officer who had worked with former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

Congress workers perform 'hawan' outside Rahul Gandhi's residence in Delhi #AssemblyElections2018 pic.twitter.com/zkuKfW9T2T

details.title: Mizoram: MNF wins 14, Congress wins 4
Mizoram CM Lal Thanhawla loses from both seats
details.content: Mizoram CM and Congress candidate Lal Thanhawla lost from both his home turf Serchhip and Champhai South seat.

details.title: Serchhip: Lal Thanhawla lose to Lalduhoma
details.content: Lal Thanhawla was defeated in Serchhip by the ZPM chief ministerial candidate Lalduhoma by a margin of 410 votes.

details.title: Champhai South: Lal Thanhawla lose to TJ Lalnuntluanga
details.content: Lal Thanhawla  lost to TJ Lalnuntluanga, a political novice and MNF nominee, by a margin of 1,049 votes in Champhai South constituency near the Myanmar border.

details.title: MNF inching towards massive win
MNF chief Zoramthanga: The Sun Tzu of Mizoram
details.content: Former rebel leader-turned-politician Zoramthanga fired from the hip and eliminated the ruling Congress in Mizoram, the grand old party’s last bastion in the Northeast. (Click Here To Read More)
Mizo National Front gets clear majority

details.title: Congress faces heavy defeat
details.content: Congress faces a heavy defeat in Mizoram elections as they manage to win just five of the 40 seats in the state.
Congress loses the last bastion in Northeast
MNF chief Zoramthanga likely to be CM

Five state election results: Big winners and losers
details.content: It's D-day for the five states which went into polls over the past one month. The results in few constituencies have been announced while counting still continues in other places. (Click Here To Read More)

details.title: MNF chief Zoramthanga's priorities
details.content: Since I am going to form the govt now my first priorities will be three things—to impose a prohibition on liquor, repair roads & implement Social Economic Development Programme (SEDP) which is our flagship programme: MNF chief Zoramthanga

details.title: We will not have any coalition government: MNF chief Zoramthanga
details.content: We will not have any coalition govt either with BJP or any other ways because my party can form the govt on its own as we have got 26 seats out of 40: MNF chief Zoramthanga

details.title: Mizoram election results: Final Tally
Lal Thanhawla submits resignation
details.content: Mizoram CM Lal Thanhawla submits resignation to Governor K Rajasekharan: Official Source
The MNF emerged victorious in the Mizoram Assembly elections, bagging 26 seats out of the 40-member assembly: Election Commission of India

details.title: Congrats to  Zoramthanga for historic win: Assam Minister Himanta Biswa
details.content:
With Mizoram constituents of #NEDA will head Govt in entire North East. We worked towards it tirelessly for last 3 yrs under leadership of @narendramodi. Congratulations to Pu Zoramthanga for historic win of #MNF in #Mizoram. Meanwhile @BJP4India also opens its account in Mizoram

— Himanta Biswa Sarma (@himantabiswa) December 11, 2018
The land-locked Mizoram in the North-East has assembly constituencies spread across eight districts, out of which 39 seats are reserved for scheduled tribes, while one is for the general category.
Currently, MNF a part of the North-East Regional Political Front, which supports the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led NDA.

details.title: MNF chief Zoramthanga's performance in Aizwal East I

details.content: A delegation of MNF led by its chief Zoramthanga met Governor Kummanam Rajasekharan after the party won 26 seats in Mizoram Assembly polls.

details.title: I underestimated the new formation ZPM: Outgoing Mizoram CM Lal Thanhawla
details.content:
Aizawl: Outgoing CM of Mizoram Lal Thanhawla submits his resignation before the Governor, says "This is very disappointing. I didn't expect this. I think I underestimated the new formation ZPM." #MizoramElections2018 pic.twitter.com/r133FUl0Eo

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018

"I congratulate Congress, MNF for their success. It clearly shows the mood of the nation," says Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik

details.title: BJP government in Centre ignored loan problems of farmers: Naveen Patnaik
details.content: These states are pre-dominantly agrarian states and BJP government in the Centre has more or less ignored the Swaminathan report recommendations & loan problems of farmers: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik
Mizoram's principal opposition party MMNF has stolen the thunder from the BJP in wiping off the Congress from the Northeast.
The BJP’s mission of playing the kingmaker and claiming the credit of defeating the Congress in its last bastion in the Northeast – Mizoram –was trumped by the MNF.

details.title: Mizoram election results: Congress wiped off the Northeast
details.content: It was an issue of prestige as well as survival for the Congress when it went to elections in Mizoram after having tasted defeats in rest of the states of the region at the hands of the BJP and its allies in North East Democratic Alliance which is a conglomerate of non-Congress political parties, mostly regional parties.(Click Here To Read More)

details.title: Mizoram's CM-in-waiting Zoramthanga's top priorities
details.content: MNF chief and Mizoram's CM-in-waiting Zoramthanga on Tuesday said that imposing a ban on liquor and developing the state's infrastructure will be among his top priorities after assuming the office of chief minister. (Click Here To Read More)

Final result status of Mizoram: Mizo National Front wins 26 seats, Congress wins 5 seats, others 9 seats. #MizoramElections2018 pic.twitter.com/l0HfI9CWkM

— ANI (@ANI) December 11, 2018
